definition: loose/to loosen/to relax/floss (dry, fluffy food product made from shredded, seasoned meat or fish, used as a topping or filling)
to shed/to take off/to escape/to get away from

sentences.english: When you've fastened the boards, tie the strings off so that they don't slip.
sentences.chinese: 木板钉牢后，把绳子打结系紧，免得松脱。

sentences.english: They may also be subject to corrosion and bolt 'creep'.
sentences.chinese: 此种锚栓也可能发生腐蚀和日渐松脱的情形。
连接到芯子的软管松脱。

sentences.english: Presently Peter let the pocket handkerchief go again.
sentences.chinese: 不久彼得又让口袋手帕松脱了。

sentences.english: When you notice a loose end on a garment, you must deal with it.
sentences.chinese: 当发现衣服有松脱的线部，你必须处理它。

sentences.english: If it is found loose lint , not a hand to Break, the application of the scissors arrows.
sentences.chinese: 若发现松脱的线头，不要用手去扯断，应用剪刀箭之。

sentences.english: The loosened coal falls onto a conveyor for removal from the mine.
sentences.chinese: 松脱的煤块落到传送带上，被运出矿井外。

sentences.english: The frequent incidents over the past month have highlighted the danger of loose and corroded aluminium window frames.
sentences.chinese: 意外频频发生，突显铝窗松脱和侵蚀的危险。

sentences.english: He decides to see the world by releasing thousands of balloons from his house.
sentences.chinese: 决定去游历世界，松脱了系在他房子上的数千气球后。

sentences.english: The worker battened down the loose windows.
sentences.chinese: 工人用板条钉牢松脱的窗户。

sentences.english: Use the brush to remove loose or dried dirt.
sentences.chinese: 使用毛笔，以消除松脱或晒干的污垢。

sentences.english: The adhesive tape seems to have dried in some cases, so that the lids became loose.
sentences.chinese: 胶带似乎在某些情况下变干燥，所以盖子便松脱了。

definition: to drop off/to come off/to lose (hair etc)/to omit (a character when writing)
to break/to sever/to turn off (electric switch)
(of a guitar, kite etc) to have a string break/(of a tradition etc) to be discontinued/(telephone or Internet connection) disconnected/cut off
to pull out/to pull a lever
loose/slack/(fig.) to soften (policies, tone of voice)/to give some slack/(of a place) not crowded
